objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: The UK National Cyber Security Centre (NCSC) authored and published this malware analysis report and supplied multiple YARA rules for detecting components related to DAMASCENED PEACOCK.

objects.name: temp.sh
objects.description: Hosting domain used to serve the signed first-stage downloader in the spear-phishing infection chain.

objects.name: journalctl.website
objects.description: Delivery domain hosting the DAMASCENED PEACOCK second-stage DLL fetched by the first-stage loader.

objects.name: journalctl.website/asldajEPqew
objects.description: Specific URL observed serving the DAMASCENED PEACOCK payload.

objects.name: apimonger.com
objects.description: Command-and-control domain for DAMASCENED PEACOCK beacons over HTTP (port 8080).

objects.name: COM hijack registry key (Synchronization Framework CLSID)
objects.description: Registry path hijacked by DAMASCENED PEACOCK to persist and execute the downloaded payload via explorer.exe.

objects.name: KeyProv.dll
objects.description: Final-stage DLL written to disk by DAMASCENED PEACOCK and set as the COM hijack target.

objects.name: Indicator for Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 of the signed first-stage downloader delivered via spear-phishing; masquerades as a PDF.

objects.name: Indicator for Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 of the signed first-stage downloader delivered via spear-phishing; masquerades as a PDF.

objects.name: Indicator for Doc_03.10.24.298133.exe (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 of the signed first-stage downloader delivered via spear-phishing; masquerades as a PDF.

objects.name: Indicator for XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll (MD5)
objects.description: MD5 of DAMASCENED PEACOCK second-stage downloader DLL.

objects.name: Indicator for XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll (SHA1)
objects.description: SHA-1 of DAMASCENED PEACOCK second-stage downloader DLL.

objects.name: Indicator for XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll (SHA256)
objects.description: SHA-256 of DAMASCENED PEACOCK second-stage downloader DLL.

objects.name: damascened peacock
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is a lightweight, staged downloader targeting Windows, observed in late-2024 spear-phishing campaigns against the UK Ministry of Defence. It is implemented as a 32-bit DLL with a single export (DllExport) and operates as the second of three stages, downloading the final payload and achieving its execution via a COM hijack into explorer.exe. It uses defence evasion techniques including XOR-based string obfuscation and dynamic resolution of Win32 APIs through custom API hashing, is proxy-aware, and communicates with its C2 at apimonger.com over HTTP port 8080. It writes the final stage to %LOCALAPPDATA%\KeyStore\KeyProv.dll and modifies the COM CLSID registry key associated with the Microsoft Synchronization Framework to persist and execute the payload, terminating explorer.exe to trigger the hijack. The first stage loader that executes DAMASCENED PEACOCK is code-signed (CN=FUTURICO LLC), and multiple campaigns have used signed stages, indicating ready access to code signing certificates. DAMASCENED PEACOCK is a variant within the RomCom malware family, situated between variants such as RustyClaw and DustyHammock.

objects.name: rustyclaw
objects.description: RustyClaw is a malware variant documented by Talos and identified as part of the broader RomCom malware family. DAMASCENED PEACOCK is described as a stage between RustyClaw and DustyHammock.

objects.name: snipbot
objects.description: SnipBot is a malware variant documented by Palo Alto Networks (Unit 42) and identified as part of the broader RomCom malware family. DAMASCENED PEACOCK is presented as a related variant.

objects.name: dustyhammock
objects.description: DustyHammock is a malware variant named within the RomCom family. DAMASCENED PEACOCK is positioned as an intermediate stage between RustyClaw and DustyHammock.

objects.name: romcom
objects.description: RomCom is described as a wider malware family encompassing variants such as RustyClaw, SnipBot, and DustyHammock. DAMASCENED PEACOCK is a variant within this family.

objects.name: MOD (UK Ministry of Defence)
objects.description: Targeted organization; the report states DAMASCENED PEACOCK was observed in a spear-phishing campaign in late 2024 targeting the UK Ministry of Defence.

objects.name: Talos
objects.description: Referenced as a source documenting the RustyClaw variant within the RomCom malware family (link provided in the report).

objects.name: Palo Alto Networks (Unit 42)
objects.description: Referenced as a source documenting the SnipBot variant within the RomCom malware family (link provided in the report).

objects.name: FUTURICO LLC
objects.description: Subject and CN of the code-signing certificate used for the first-stage executable that loads DAMASCENED PEACOCK.

objects.name: GlobalSign nv-sa
objects.description: Issuer organization of the EV code-signing certificate used to sign the first-stage loader that executes DAMASCENED PEACOCK.

objects.name: GlobalSign GCC R45 EV CodeSigning CA 2020
objects.description: Certificate Authority (CN) that issued the EV code-signing certificate used by FUTURICO LLC for the first-stage malware loader.

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_resolve_apis
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_resolve_apis {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Targets a code pattern which is used to resolve
APIs in the first stage which loads DAMASCENED PEACOCK."
        hash1 = "1bd5b9fec7ccc29144989203c3b15a10c9c22a76"

    strings:

    $ = {56 31 C0 85 D2 74 1D 0F B6 31 41 4A 69 F6 [4] 0F AF F6 C1

C6 10 31 C6 0F AF F6 C1 C6 10 89 F0 EB DF 5E C3}
    condition:

    (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550

and all of them
}

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_winhttpconnect
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_winhttpconnect {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets a code pattern in DAMASCENED
PEACOCK which sees the resolved pointer for WinHttpConnect retrieved from
a struct, arguments pushed e.g. 8080 as the port, and then a call."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ = {8B 85 90 00 00 00 6A 00 68 90 1F 00 00 FF 76 34 FF 33 FF D0}
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them
}

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashes
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashing_algorithm
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_API_hashing_algorithm {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets the code in DAMASCENED PEACOCK
used for generating an API hash. The rule is agnostic of the constants
used to generate the hash."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ =
{8D0C0669C9[4]8D5201C1C9??81C1[4]03C1C1C8??0FAFC60FBE3203C08BC8C1C8??C1C9
??85F6}
    condition:
        any of them
}

objects.name: DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule DAMASCENED_PEACOCK_strings {
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "This rule targets the original name and export
name in DAMASCENED PEACOCK."
        hash1 = "8c25b982e5e4b3418b779c85b8ac8a6acf393063"

    strings:
        $ = "XcsExplorerDll_x86.dll"
        $ = "DllExport"
    condition:
        (uint16(0) == 0x5A4D) and uint32(uint32(0x3C)) == 0x00004550 and
all of them
}

objects.name: Gather Victim Host Information
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK checks whether the victim host is 32-bit or 64-bit to determine the appropriate next stage to download.

objects.name: Phishing: Spearphishing Link
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is executed by a first stage that is delivered via a link in an email.

objects.name: User Execution: Link
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is executed by a first stage that is delivered via a link in an email.

objects.name: User Execution: Malicious File
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK is executed by a first stage which is reliant upon the user running the file.

objects.name: Inter-Process Communication: Component Object Model
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK achieves execution for the 3rd stage it downloads by COM Hijacking explorer.exe.

objects.name: Obfuscated Files or Information: Encrypted/Encoded File
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK XOR encodes configuration strings used throughout.

objects.name: Obfuscated Files or Information: Dynamic API Resolution
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK uses an API hashing algorithm combined with Dynamic Resolution of Win32 APIs to obfuscate functionality.

objects.name: Subvert Trust Controls: Code Signing
objects.description: The first stage of the malware is signed, meaning DAMASCENED PEACOCK executes within a signed, malicious process.

objects.name: Masquerading
objects.description: The first stage of DAMASCENED PEACOCK is an executable with an icon and filename indicating it is a PDF.

objects.name: Application Layer Protocol: Web Protocols
objects.description: DAMASCENED PEACOCK communicates with the command and control server over HTTP.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Damascened Peacock
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. damascened peacock.
